website_summaries.verdict: Crystal clear reception, good mic pickup, fast charging, and solid reliability make this the best all-around model.
pros: Headset connects to its partner up to a kilometer away
Clear reception of voice and music
Jog dial makes it easy to change modes quickly and safely while riding
cons: Microphone can pick up wind noise if not positioned exactly right

customer_reviews.title: OMG!  What a mess!  NEED HELP!
customer_reviews.text: One of the units out of the two pack quit working and SENA doesn't seem to want to help. I have been talking to Agent #09 Ticket number 277552 and I keep getting run around in circles. They requested a receipt so I sent them a screen shot of the order from Amazon along with a pic of the box that they came in with serial numbers. They keep saying that isn't good enough. I am getting so frustrated trying to call and emails. That unit has only been used maybe 3-4 times. I need help and I don't know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Features
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. The options are excellent: Listen to music from your phone while riding, connect to other riders (up to 3 others and yourself) so you can communicate, can use Siri functions such as asking what time it is or making phone calls. The one thing that is excellent but can throw you for a loop is that each function has its independent volume level. When I first tried to use Siri, I heard nothing and thought it wasn’t working. However once I turned up the volume, I found it was working perfectly. It remembers each volume setting. So after using each function and adjusting volume levels, you are good to go from that point on.
customer_reviews.author: D_Nichols

customer_reviews.title: very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: easily able to connect intercom with friends when riding and has pretty good audio quality for music via bluetooth. Would recommend upgrading the firmware after you buy (which is a pain, but i wont let that reflect my rating). Just remember when installing the sena device manager to right click and Run As Administration before beginning the install which will save you a ton of time. Had to mess around with powering it on and off while connected to computer to get it to detect. very finicky software.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M

customer_reviews.title: Great for coaching
customer_reviews.text: Got this headset to use when coaching car-to-car HPDE. Works great. Sounds better than my old chatterbox for in-car communications. There is a slight lag but nothing terrible. I believe they are phasing this line of product out however, as there is a newer one out now. My only complaint is that they appear to have discontinued the SMH-A0303 base that could be used with these to let the student use earbuds rather than in-helmet speakers. Since this is the case, make sure you order all the accessories you want immediately if you buy this radio; they may not be available much longer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Herzog

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget. You'll need to do a Firmware Update...so make sure you do. We have iPhone 7's and couldn't connect to them until we did the update. Also the speakers are rather large and it takes time to adjust in your helmet to properly line up with your ears. I have a tight helmet and it's been a struggle with the speakers and sunglasses. I had to buy goggles in order to make it comfortable with the strap on the outside of my helmet. Also...all of the numbers listed in the documentation were disconnected and referred you to two different numbers which one was also disconnected. Very difficult to get customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl F.

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased these years ago...........
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for several months now. First time intercom user. It certainly makes riding more enjoyable talking with the other riders about choice of restuarants, directions, and so forth. Speaker clarity is exceptional. Charge will last about 12 hours. Keep track of charge b/c they will die without warning. I use these on a 3/4 helmet and a 1/2 helmet. With the 1/2 helmet be sure to order the ear pads that attach to helmet straps.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Poor noise control. Unable to update firmware.
customer_reviews.text: Unable to update firmware. Questionable tech support for known issue. No noise cancellation, if anything it amplifies wind noise. Even with a full face shield it sounds like you have a hair dryer jammed in your helmet on intercom. It is a shame too, unit is well designed and easy to use. The noise issue appears to be only with the intercom feature which points to firmware. Phone calls are clear with no reports of noise from the caller. Research shows a large group of people have the same issue with both noise and unable to update. Sena tech support suggests I try on another computer even though the computer will update my SMH5 built in unit on another helmet.
customer_reviews.author: C & G

customer_reviews.title: If you ride with others or one up and want hear and be heard this is the product
customer_reviews.text: We were impressed! The clearity and volume they provide was way better than the set we had before. If you turned it up too high it would ring you ears. I was able to make phone calls while traveling 75 mph and there was no complaints of road noise. We paired them with other riders on bikes that would be several hundred feet away at times and the conversation continued without issues. It made our trip very enjoyable and made navigating with other bikes very easy. If you haven't experienced the quality if a Sena product or purchased one of the cheaper set before, like me, be prepared to be impressed
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: terrible music reproduction
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing I have to say about this is the ease of operation. After that they fail. The speakers reproduce conversations well but fall horribly short when it comes to music. Think of the sound coming from your grandmother’s 1974 Dodge Dart AM radio, it was better. Your iPhone’s speaker is better. You cannot adjust the mike sensitivity and every little blast of air key’s the conversation mode. Terribly annoying when it’s just you and the device is constantly telling you that the intercom failed. To remedy this you have to turn off the voice activated (VOX) feature and manually begin each conversation.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Parry

customer_reviews.title: Voice Activation feature does not work - Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I received, I had figured it was defective since one of the speakers did not work. When i received a replacement, after about 6 months, the voice activation command feature stopped functioning. I can no longer change my music or turn on/off navigation, etc. with this device. Very frustrated with the lack of durability in this device.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for communicating on trails snowmobiling. It’s awesome to ride with others and be blue to communicate so easily while on the trails. With proper speaker placement (inline with your ears) speakers are clear and loud enough for me to have to turn down. Range is fine as well. Overall I give them a 4/34 stars....only issue is I wish the mount was on an angle so you can keep space between helmet and bracket where Sena Clips into as my helmet has an angled side and I had to put a spacer behind it so the Sena would fully clip in, but it was an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Mazzy2124

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wait, buy these
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for our snowmobile helmets and they work. They are not noise cancelling and personally wouldn’t want noise canceling for this application. Not designed for all helmets but works on most. I use a 509 helmet, and this didn’t fit the countour of my helmet but with some creativity it works great now. Been thinking about these for 3 years, should have bought them a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: randy reid

customer_reviews.title: A big mistake
customer_reviews.text: I have a ‘19 Harley Road Glide Ultra. Between the infotainment system and my iPhone, you can only use one feature at a time. It won’t sync into the factory Harley system ! The intercom system between me and my wife sounds very tinny and the road noise is horrible. This is using a full face helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Barstow

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing product!! My wife and I will never ride with out these again!!
customer_reviews.text: I can not say how much I love our Sena's. These things are amazing and have seriously taken our riding to a while new awesome level! I was able to help my wife learn how to ride on the road with these. We have be able to share amazing moments together on our rides instead of being separated by distance. They just always seem to work incredibly!!! I can not suggest these things any more highly!! They are totally worth every penny and we will never ride with out these things again!
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in June. The mic doesn't work. I called Sena for a replacement. Still haven't received. Purchased another mic at my own cost, guess what? It doesn't work either. Done with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Loud, and Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use, pretty loud, and very convenient. Distance between coms is line of sight, no matter what the description says. In that line of sight, the coms are very clear, and you can even share music, which is very nice. There really is no noise cancellation, which is one of the questions I was asked, but that's okay. With the volume at maximum, and ear-plugs in, music and coms sound fine.
customer_reviews.author: GV360

customer_reviews.title: SENA headset
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the intercoms on my 2 helmets. The intercoms have not been used together while riding yet. I did use the one in my helmet to stream music and make phone calls. Speaker quality seems very good. I did follow the YouTube video on music sharing but so far I was able to pair the headsets once. The other times my second headset would not pair music. Still trying. I just hope I don’t have to go through the lengthy process every time.
customer_reviews.author: red90harley

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth ever
customer_reviews.text: For the past few years we have ordered Bluetooth for the helmet but they were cheap and didn't work. So I went to the source for the Zumo GPS for motorcycles and they recommended the Sena SMH10. My husband is a little hard of hearing but he could hear this just fine, in fact he had to turn the volume down. It was easy to install and pair. We love it. Thank you for a great product. I just wish you packed a users guide in package so I didn't have to download & print.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen F. Pousada

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended Headset
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific product and it's packaged with a complete set of charging cables and mounting options. Very nice. My only complaints are that it could use a little more volume and frequency response. Both of these options would require much more power. Battery life is always a consideration in portable devices and that trumps everything else. Another great feature is that you mount the speakers and mic and they stay in place. The unit can be charged while in use -- with either of the provided cables -- or quickly released to take in with you to charge in the house. How convenient. Also, it has lots of options for pairing with Bluetooth devices and other headsets.
customer_reviews.author: LKN G-Man

customer_reviews.title: My SMH10 dead after one use
customer_reviews.text: Received 2 units. They worked great the first day. One unit after recharging is as dead as a hammer. I need these right now as planned rides are made. The SMH10 lasted 6 hours. I suspect the internal battery won’t hold a charge. I contacted mfg but got an automated email.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife and I when we ride together. They have worked great and last quite a long time on a single charge. I have ridden in the rain several times with this and have not had any issues with it. The VOX function is a bit too sensitive. It would activate the intercom with wind noise at about 70-70mph. Sharing music is easy from either headset. I have used Google Maps for navigation through the headset while listening to music and it has worked flawlessly. All in all, this was a great purchase at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good communicators
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good units. They come paired with each other already so there is no pairing to do. Just charge up, turn on and go. Sound quality is just average. Very tinny when listening to music and there is some static occasionally when communicating with a partner. Also, these only come with a boom mic which isn’t the greatest for a full face helmet, but you can definitely make it work still.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V.

customer_reviews.title: Quite loud Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the setup correct, it was awesome. Tried it out on my ride to work this morning, and the directions were actually too loud, I had to turn it down. That bodes well for other stuff. I have not actually used it for a call yet, but may update the review once I do. Make sure you place the "mic cover" piece that comes in, it picks up serious whistling if you so not. Update: I finally used the headset for a call. I could hear my friend quite well, and they also heard me clearly, although they mentioned a sound that they thought was me shuffling papers, but it was not objectionable. Upping the rating to 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product approximately two months ago. We have used them for approximately 1,500 miles of driving. Battery life is as advertised. Sound quality may be the only weak point, but I attribute this to the general size of the speakers not necessarily to a lack of quality in design or manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Jose P.

customer_reviews.title: Best  Communication Device Ever
customer_reviews.text: Took this device with me on a 7000 mile motorcycle trip around the U.S. and it was a godsend. I love this and have never owned one before. Not only could I keep in touch [clear and strong sound] with my fellow motorcyclists, I could also answer my cell phone when a call came in and the caller could not tell I was riding 80mph in the wind! It also allowed me to listen to my music and hear directions from my GPS. Wow.... what an incredible product! Will never make a motorcycle trip again without it. I bought a second one to use with my passenger on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Boatman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not noise cancelling. For the money, these are good. Sound is OK. I can hear music ok and phone calls are OK. Installation is super easy and takes about 10 minutes. I would not recommend buying cheaper models. You get what you pay for. If you want excellent, you will pay more.
customer_reviews.author: TRA

customer_reviews.title: best piece of gear Ive gotten in years
customer_reviews.text: I havent done a review in years. I needed to tell anyone considering a headset, that this Sena headset is without a doubt the best piece of gear Ive bought for my dual sport in years! I rode for 6 hours recently with a friend who also had a Sena and we talked at least 5 of the 6 hour ride. It was the most enjoyable ride ive had in many years. We chatted as if we where sitting in a car next to each other. super simple and easy to use. Only when we got to about 600-800 yards away did reception fade. We almost always rode close anyway.
customer_reviews.author: kevin molick

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We have used this once so far, my wife on her bike and me on mine. It was great to be able to talk all the way through a few hour ride. She sometimes gets a few telephone poles behind me but no problem At higher speeds it does pick up some wind noise but not enough to be a bother. We are very pleased, riding is much better now
customer_reviews.author: John M. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, turns biking into a social experience.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and an extra bracket to give as a Father's Day gift. This intercom system is amazing. We heard no wind noise and sound was clear at highway speeds. I had trouble with components on one bracket and Sena offered me two troubleshooting options. The first option did the trick and I am pleased. Got my phone paired to it, listened to music and made a phone call. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Arvella

customer_reviews.title: The best money I've spent for dirt bike riding with my 10 year old son
customer_reviews.text: The best money I've spent for dirt bike riding with my 10 year old son. We can now communicate where we couldn't before which allows me to help him through tricky situations on trails or to communicate when we will be turning. He can also let me know if he falls if I don't see it. Also, we enjoy the music sharing feature!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good helmet speaker system
customer_reviews.text: I got this along with a Garmin Zumo 595LM gps so I could hear the gps directions while I was on my bike. The instructions were clear and the helmet installation was easy. It was reasonable easy to pair with the Zumo; the volume inside my helmet is excellent, and easily heard at highway speeds.
customer_reviews.author: wfwkwa

customer_reviews.title: It's just what you want.  Communication.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. My son and I now speak without trouble. We also share music. Range down my Open Country Road, 6 tenths of a mile. I had no static at all. All except for the last 20 or 30 ft. then full loss. I turned around,peddled back the 20/ 30 feet,signal came right back. clear as a bell. I tested the Sena on my bicycle
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Still the best intercom on the market! Great range, no road noise at all between riders, great music quality and very long battery life. It easily lasted 8-12 riding days and still had really good range in the mountains even when line of sight was lost. Only issue is we couldn't figure out how to share music or play music without cutting off the other rider.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Just do it!
customer_reviews.text: We tried a cheap pair of headsets and what a waste of money. We should have gotten these in the first place. I wear a 3/4 helmet and my husband wears a 1/2 helmet. We have no issues hearing each other even with the wind. It’s very easy to switch back and forth from taking to music. Also, if one of us forgets our phone, we can share music to the other person. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Mason

customer_reviews.title: It was excellent in that it was easy to install on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this Bluetooth headset to communicate with my buddy who had a similar model. We used it on a motorcycle trip to the White Mountains, New Hampshire. It was excellent in that it was easy to install on my full face helmet, and despite being Bluetooth we could talk clearly up to 0.6 miles apart. The battery lasted all day. The sound quality and VOX performance of this device way exceeded my expectations. A bonus was being able to interrupt our chatter and receive or make calls from my iPhone. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Gillott

customer_reviews.title: I love this system
customer_reviews.text: I love this system! It works incredibly well and we easily get a full day's worth of communication with it on our motorcycles. Connection is related to line-of-sight, so when we're in a mountain or city environment there might be some fuzz, but we never lose the actual connection. We can hear each other easily up to 110kph, and probably higher if the wind noise in our helmets wasn't so bad.The system syncs up easily with 1-2 other units (never tried more than that). Recharges overnight (never timed it precisely). Holds up well under all weather conditions. I am glad that we bought this system. It has been by far the best possible decision.
customer_reviews.author: DantesDame

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set for my wife and I to use in the desert on our side by side. Really happy with them. Makes the ride much more interactive and that makes it more fun for my wife. So far, so good. Instructions are kind of lacking, but pretty easy to install and use. Haven’t used them enough to comment on battery life. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Burton

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases my wife and I have made for our ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases my wife and I have made for our motorcycles. Pros: - Excellent battery life - Easy to install - Buttons easy to use with riding gloves on - Paired easily with Samsung Galaxy s4 Cons: - Have to repeat things multiple times when at interstate speeds. This may be typical for 3/4 helmets though. - Have to turn it all the way up sometimes to hear the other rider - Can't hear GPS directions while talking with another rider. (If listening to music, it turns the music down so you can hear the voice guidance)
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Loved it when it worked, unfortunately, today when I went to use it, it didn’t. I used it maybe a dozen times since June as I usually wear a 1/2 helmet. Last evening, I plugged it in to charge, blue light was on this morning. As soon as it can off the charger, the light went out and it wouldn’t come on. So now I have a $136 Sena that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S. Epps

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years and it's just great to converse with my fellow riders and listen to music if I want and sometimes take a call. While I haven't used it for long in the rain I haven't had a problem as long as the charge tab is closed.
customer_reviews.author: donmitt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing noise cancelling performance.
customer_reviews.text: I like these headsets, but they do not cancel out wind noise. Our main helmets are 3/4 size with face shields. The microphones are usually behind the face shield. Still have a lot of wind noise come across the mics. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Branham

customer_reviews.title: Great for two to ride with
customer_reviews.text: We ride quite often. My son and I took a 3500 mile trip and were able to really utilize the headphones. It was nice to be able to communicate where I was intending on going so there was no surprises. I think there is an added safety factor when you can relay back or forward to your riding partner on an upcoming obstacle in the road and have complete communication when you need it. Listening to music, and paring with my Zumo GPS is really nice too. The sound quality is good and there is ample volume to hear while traveling at 70mph+. This is our second set of Sena's. With out a doubt, they really do what is advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: call someone or listen to music is great, you are not going to be disappointed when ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few rides of always shouting to communicate with my girlfriend while being on my bike I decided to buy this one since my bell helmet has the place to install it inside after using it for w couple of months I can say that you really don't know how this can change your life, being able to chat away through a ride makes it not only easier but you don't get tired as much, also being able to respond to phone calls, call someone or listen to music is great, you are not going to be disappointed when you buy this product I can guarantee you that
customer_reviews.author: Rubén Prieto

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headsets. My wife and I finally got do some riding this weekend and they worked great. User friendly, just make sure you go over the book first. They also have a Sena App for phones with a quick reference guide on how to pair phones, groups, radios and so forth. Took a couple phone calls while riding and they didnt know I was on my bike until I told them. Sound is clear but quality of sound is lacking as far as listening to music, but that was expected according to reviews. I would recommend these to anybody. Dont waste your money on other cheaper bluetooths.
customer_reviews.author: Martin H.

customer_reviews.title: Makes the ride so much more enjoyable and less dangerous
customer_reviews.text: When riding double on a motorcycle it is very hard to communicate without this intercom. Now we can talk about what we see and where we are going, when we are ready to stop, etc.... without having to yell and gesture. Works great and fit on my helmet perfectly. This is an older model, but it matches my boyfriends so they are compatible.
customer_reviews.author: L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cents on smh 10
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It feels like they used high quality materials. Extra sticky velcro pieces would be better. Not super bass but good enough to where you wouldn't be bothered. Phone on it has great quality. One thing I would say that if they made the clip where it didn't interfere with the design of the helmet but make it make it to where you could have it stick to the side of the helmet without noticing a difference. I may want to drill a few holes to make it feel flush. Great stuff. I'll update later if any concerns pop up
customer_reviews.author: phuc21

customer_reviews.title: Best for Skiing!
customer_reviews.text: I use this not only for motorcycle riding, but also skiing. Put it on your helmet with speakers in ear pads (some helmets like my GIRO Ledge can put speakers in ear pads) then you can enjoy conversation with your partner on ski slopes.
customer_reviews.author: Beam

customer_reviews.title: ... a year I can say that they are a good system. I use them for passenger communication
customer_reviews.text: After having these for a year I can say that they are a good system. I use them for passenger communication. Have not tried cycle to cycle comm. Pairs nicely with each other and other devices like my ipod touch, phone etc. Speakers are tinney sounding. OK for voice--not so good for music. Volume level is easily varied and sufficiently loud when you need it. Wind noise can be a problem even with the included windscreens which was a surprise considering my BMW K1200LT has some of the best wind protection ever made on a bike. Will try to find better windscreen if I can. Batteries when fully charged----easily last a full day of riding! Glad I bought this set.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best headset
customer_reviews.text: Best set on the market. I also have Hawk-2 and Blinc systems- this one is much better than both of them. Sound quality is very good and I can hear great even at high speed. Very good connectivity to iPhone- intuitive and easy to use. Absolutely love it- don’t be lured by the cheap cost of other sets- there is a reason this one is expensive- it is very good quality
customer_reviews.author: Ivan T Stoev

customer_reviews.title: Works best 3 or less riders.no 3.5 jack. Poor sound quality through poor speakers.
customer_reviews.text: The 10 actually works better than my 20 in some respects. Pairs pretty well with 3 or less riders. No 3.5 mm earbud hack. Need mini USB/ 3.5 MM adapter. Speakers a tiny, very poor sound quality. If your helmet, or bike, is noisy forget it.
customer_reviews.author: cometattack

customer_reviews.title: Great headset... worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: The Sena SMH10-10 is a robust little piece of bluetooth hardware. The battery lasted an average of 8 hours when touring with music playing fairly loud (ear plugs) and intermittent conversation. Seems to hold up to rain without issue. Connects well to my iPhone 4s, and other SMH-10s easily. It did have an issue with my Tom Tom Rider 400 and wouldn't connect to a Sena 20 after several tries, hence only 4 stars. Good little piece of kit, and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: M G M Jr

customer_reviews.title: For great comms between rider and passenger, simple bluetooth connectivity for iphone and satnav - its the best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to replace my aging Autocomm unit and to be cordless. I would say this is the best couple of hundred dollars I have spent in years. The ease of use, long lasting battery (on the move rechargeable), simple blue tooth connectivity to both my Garmin Zumo 550 and my iphone 4S make this unit a pleasure to use. It also allows me to use SIRI whilst connected to send and recieve text messages. It flawlessly uses the A2DP with my phone so I can listen to music whilst also being connected to the Satnav to receive verbal instructions. I would recommend this item to anyone who rides a motorbike.
customer_reviews.author: Trosty

customer_reviews.title: I love this Headset
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Just finished a 1300 mile ride with a friend in the mountains of North Carolina and these headsets were great to talk with other motorcycle rider. no hand signals to tell other motorcycle rider what's going on and was awesome when going around blind curves on the Dragon to warn other rider of what was coming the other way or if a slow vehicle was in our lane. distance was about the advertised 900 FT if you lose contact when you get back in range they will automatically reconnect. battery life was all day never went dead on us. I will never ride without one again. Also music and phone calls are cristal clear.
customer_reviews.author: James Ross

customer_reviews.title: first time users
customer_reviews.text: like the product itself but the speakers have no bass for the music. this makes for poor music quality. it does serve it purpose well as intercom between rider and passenger. my wife wears a 3/4 helmet so positioning of the mic for optimum voice and reduced wind interference is the tricky part. prefer earbuds for music but otherwise for this being our first use of headset with helmets we're satisfied with the result thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: the only thing i don't like is, if the other person isn't wearing a ...
customer_reviews.text: this headset is a must have for anyone who rides. connects to your phone, has hands free capability, and also works as an intercom. i've taken it on a couple of group rides and it works well even if the other person is a few cars behind you. also, i can listen to my music. the only thing i don't like is, if the other person isn't wearing a helmet with a shield, you get a lot of wind noise in your earphones. but that's just related to the helmet. the product itself works great. well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Feese

customer_reviews.title: OMG!  this headset rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd be happy with it, but i'm ecstatic! the sound is phenomenal for it's size. the bluetooth connectivity to my iPhone is superb! I've made many calls, received a few too. Siri works flawlessly and has no issues with voice recognition! You will NOT be disappointed! buy it! installation was a breeze! I have a Scorpion EXO-900 Transformer helmet and the only thing i have an issue with is remembering the boom when flipping up my chin guard since I cannot remove the diffuser chin curtain. but that's it. this headset is the best of the best!! worth the full retail price! getting it for almost $90 less than retail it's a steal!
customer_reviews.author: James D. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I was told by some other motorcycle guys this was the best brand and they were right. Very pleased with how well everything synced up with my phone. YouTube videos helped get the music and intercom working at the same time. My fiance and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin K

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth system ive found
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on these and other bluetooth headsets. I really liked the price and quality of these. I have used them for half a season so far, but the battery is amazing. I drove 10 hours in one day and it lasted the entire day and died around 10 hours. I only used it for music, but that's great. Super happy with the system. Only con I can think of is that I wish it was more of a sleeker design so it didn't look bulky on my helmet. Another pro, I had a phone conversation with a friend going 80mph on the freeway and seemed to hear each other just fine without issues.
customer_reviews.author: juspain

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy happy..
customer_reviews.text: I ride pretty much everywhere and these are now a complete must when I do. Installation was quick and straight forward and after charging I was ready to go. I personally use this with my Galaxy S3 synced with BlueTooth and have no complaints. I have the ability to stream pandora, accept phone calls, etc. I also ride quite often with a friend and having the ability to chat while riding is very nice. I can be listening to music from my phone, he can hit the button to switch to talk mode, it will connect directly with mine without me having to do anything. I would strongly recommend these units and would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I used a pair of these on a motorcycle trip to Colorado with my brother-n-law. Range was good, a little noisy at 3/4 mile, and would occasionally lose him at 3/4 mile with a sharp curve behind a cliff. I do not consider that a negative, in fact, they worked better than I expected. Battery life was excellent, we rode 10 hour days and had no problems. I answered my phone several times and they didn't know I was on the bike at highway speed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: CLF

customer_reviews.title: Good but stuttered
customer_reviews.text: Good but stuttered, had to return them because one of the two would always stutter now matter what I did with it, the moment my bike starts moving from a stop, the headphones stutter, one of the two only, the other was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was going to return these but glad I didn't. Took me a while to figure out how to mount them. I was afraid I would ruin my new helmet by sliding the clip between the lining and shell but it worked fine. Sound is amazing. Husband and I are new riders at 58 and 53 years old. We ride seperate bikes and I'm still a little afraid of curves and especially GRAVEL! Anyway, these worked great. Nice clear sound and great range. This was a birthday gift to myself! Glad I bought them. Makes riding more enjoyable and safer. Haven't used the phone feature or played music so I don't know anything about that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Bomb-Diggity!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these headsets. I have used them with an iPhone 4/5 and now a 6 and paired with friends for rides and they are AWESOME SAUCE! The sound quality is a bit lacking in the bass department but I remedied that by removing the ear pieces from a $10 set of Koss headsets and soldiering them in. I believe there is a online video somewhere showing how to do this if you can't figure it out. That greatly improved the sound quality and I LOVE LOVE having them, can't imagine riding without it now.
customer_reviews.author: TahoeBob

customer_reviews.title: Good value and terrific functionality
customer_reviews.text: After one year of usage, and many other similar and more expensive products tryed out... this is not perfect but it is pretty darn near perfect. ex: I sometimes forget a particular command if I don't use it for a few weeks, then I have to lookup the manual. Sometimes the command is not that intuitive... but you only have 2 buttons and a wheel to work with. Great battery life and outstanding sound quality from phones and mic. Great usability even with gloves. The installation was a breeze and it never needed to be readjusted. I only with it could be upgraded with even better speakers for richer base.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Masch

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to update the unit if you're using Siri on the iPhone 6!
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. Really good for phone calls when riding. People who I'm talking to are amazed to hear I was riding a motorcycle. The sound is very clear, however, there's just no bass. I think that's inevitable for all motorcycle helmets, unfortunately. I used it with an iPhone 6 and at first Siri wouldn't register when I would stop talking so it would just sit there continuing to record everything. I updated the unit with the newest firmware from the SENA website and it fixed that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ortwein

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works great. Buy  it.
customer_reviews.text: Used for snowmobiling. At 0F still works very well. Did not run out of battery, used all day. But still charge d it every night. Takes a little while to get use to. Having a conversation at 50 mph is a little strange. But easier than stopping every intersection. Can get a lot more riding/ miles in. Highly recommend. Did not try the Bluetooth for music or phone calls. Other riding buddies use it and they say it works great.
customer_reviews.author: ScottNH

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: This actually works! I had Cardo before and had nothing but troubles with it. Sena delivers, it even survived small crash when it was fly away and I found it later floating in the puddle, picked it up and snapped back, and it continued to work.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Ignatyev

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: In short, the Sena has completely transformed our (my wife and I) riding experience! Seamlessly synchs with our iPhones for music, phone, and texting via the Siri voice interface. The intercom option works flawlessly and allows hands-free communication between rider and passenger. There is virtually no wind noise, throughout all functions, at speeds up to 95 mph (provided the mic boom is positioned correctly). The controls are simple and work well. I couldn't recommend this product any more enthusiastically! Here are the particulars for my use of the Sena: Motorcycle: Triumph Speedmaster with flyscreen Helmets: HJC IS-MAX BT
customer_reviews.author: USMC7002

customer_reviews.title: Good volume, easy to use, good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is the wiring routing inside the helmet. Mounting the main unit is super easy and it can fit most helmets; the wire for the weaker close to the main unit probably won't be a problem but the other one has to be routed and affixed somehow, that's the challenge ( I ended using some black electrical tape and went around the lower contour of the helmet. The other thing is to get the speakers as close as possible to your ears. They mount easy with an included Velcro . The pairing process was quite easy with my iPhone 4S and the intercom too, works from at at least 500 ft. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Perez

customer_reviews.title: This is the best investment ive made for our bikes
customer_reviews.text: This is the best investment ive made for our bikes. We started off with the Scala Rider Q2 pro three years ago but often had wind noise and they were a little more difficult getting the intercom initially working. After three years the one unit, either my ear receivers or my wifes boom mike went bad so we opted to buy the Sena SMH10D-10. This dual headset wonderful. No wind noise, very clear sharp voice and worked for us up to 1/2 mile. When you turn the units on we can speak to one another within 2 seconds. We love these and i would highly recommend this. Thank you Richard
customer_reviews.author: he4giv

customer_reviews.title: Great to use when riding
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend. He and some friends took a road/motorcycle trip for a week. They used this to stay in touch with each other. The sound quality was awesome. I called him while they were crushing the highway and it sounded like he was next to me and not driving on a busy road. He loves it
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: We had the earlier version of Sena SMH5 and were pleased with it. However the newer 100-10 series is even better. Simple to install & operate. Better noise cancellation and better battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy installation, comfortable and easy to use! Installed easily on my full-face and half helmet and allows my gf and I to talk and listen to music on our rides. Bluetooth works great for phone calls especially in the full-face helmet. It helps to put your hand over the mic with the half helmet to block a little more wind noise when on intercom or calls. Haven't had time to fully test the range but I can still talk to my gf even if she walks into a convenience on stops to get something to eat or drink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked very well for a week. Then the ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for a week. Then the music streaming function (from my iPhone 5c) stopped not to return. It took 5 days to get a response from Sena. I have since returned the Headset to Amazon. I will shortly order a replacement and hopefully it will perform as it should. To be fair the Sena is rated probably the best of those out there. Hopefully this first one was just a fluke. I will say that it did have more useable and clear speaker volume than a Cardo Scala Q2 I have been previously using. I hope to post a more detailed and positive report on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Bowyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a 3/4 helmet and am very happy except at high speeds but most of that has to do with the helmet and not a whole lot you can do to block out noise except by going with a full face helmet. Intercom works great and distances very good.
customer_reviews.author: MikeNLuna

customer_reviews.title: Crap high pitch audio,,,speakers are Junk plain and simple
customer_reviews.text: It blows my mind how expensive this set was for having the worst sounding speakers on the planet for music,,, as a com it works ok,,, I'm highly dissatisfied with this set... 🤬😡🤬😡
customer_reviews.author: Cody w

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had another device, Interphone, the difference from Sena is incredible. Sena is far far better, well built, and reliable. The sound is loud enough to listen to music with your full face helmet, or open face (in low speed). I have used it on the road for telephone calls and people always challenge me that I'm actually riding a motorcycle while I'm talking with them.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Castro

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to 30k
customer_reviews.text: Used headset for intercom and music from phone worked ok. Returned and upgraded to 30k. So far it was worth upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Got these so my best friend and I talk when we ride together and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these so my best friend and I talk when we ride together and also listen to our music when ever we ride. They work great, the intercom between us is clear and has a decent range. The music is so nice to have and makes it so much more fun to hit the road with my tunes. The controls are easy to control even when wearing my riding gloves so I think others will like this headset as much as we do.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Big fan!
customer_reviews.text: Buying the proprietary rig for my Nelson modular was going to cost over $300 and the reviews weren't great. The Sena costs half as much and works awesome. My friends got the SMH10-R low profile one and we have a great time talking while taking long rides. People I talk to on the phone can't tell I'm on my bike! Bluetooth for music leaves something to be desired and the volume could stand to go about a quarter louder, but I'm in a loud helmet, when I'm off the bike it sounds great! Voice commands are flawless. Installation was a breeze. Overall I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pedal Pusher

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these for a few months now and absolutely love them. The only issue is that my wife (passenger) gets a lot more wind than I do, so I hear the wind coming through the whole time we're in talk mode. We just turn off talk mode when we're not talking and that takes care of that, but these are awesome! Of course, you do have to remember to go to stand by mode when you go to the bathroom because the range is great!
customer_reviews.author: JCBiker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price. Buy a cheaper unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after owning the cheap BT-2 headsets expecting a huge difference considering the price. Wrong ! The plus is that the intercom is a lot louder. The minus is the the speakers suck badly. Intercom mode is good but dont even bother trying to play music. You will get a headache with the trebely garbage sound. Not worth the $ if you ask me. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY HEIM

customer_reviews.title: Love this Sena product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this headset and then took a motorcycle trip from Minnesota to Washington state, and it worked absolutely fantastic. I ended up also purchasing a headset from Sena that you can use with earbuds, instead of speakers, but this one works just great. They both perform as advertised. I had my GPS and phone going and never had a problem. The battery life is fantastic. I put in a couple of days where I drove over 10 hours, and this thing did not miss a beat. Do not hesitate buying this unit. It is easy to use, and works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: mrw

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy Sena
customer_reviews.text: They will not stick by their product!! I have had this for just over 2 years and now it will not hold a charge. I consider myself a light user and kept it charged but now it won't hold a charge. I have contacted support and they have determined that its a bad unit but won't replace it because of the time. I cannot support a company that won't stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Farris

customer_reviews.title: This battery lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My riding buddy and I went halvsies on this two pack and we both love it. I have spoken on the phone using it and it sounds great. You can listen to Pandora while you are riding, which is really nice. We can hear each other up to about a quarter mile apart. We used them right out of the box for several multi-hour rides and I listened to a good bit of music while riding by myself before having to charge mine. My buddy's just died for the first time the other night. They are very impressive and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Man

customer_reviews.title: Gives me my Music while I ride.
customer_reviews.text: I use them on my helmet to listen to music while I ride; not sure how I would sound to people if I actually picked up a phone call as I don't do that. My reason for the 4 stars is I wish I could remove the microphone arm since I don't use it. Maybe it can be removed without breaking it, but I dont want to pull to hard and have that happen.
customer_reviews.author: Gotallofthem

customer_reviews.title: Really REALLY great
customer_reviews.text: These work awesome! Easy to set up, easy to use, etc. I was worried about being able to fit it into/onto my full-face helmet, but it was incredibly easy using the included adapters. You don't even need to re-pair when you use them again. Just press the button once and you're talking again! Plus, listening to music works great, and you can even share your music with your intercom partner. Fabulous product. Would easily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Johns

customer_reviews.title: Best Sena for the money
customer_reviews.text: For a refurb this was perfect. Works as good if not better then my new Sena I ordered a few years back. Perfect for my spare helmet
customer_reviews.author: V. Vergalito

customer_reviews.title: Reliable headsets.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I really enjoy these headsets. Pairing was a breeze and battery life is great. My only complaint is that the volume is not high enough with my noisy helmet.
customer_reviews.author: BBrown

customer_reviews.title: This works awesome for talking and driving instructions on Google but as ...
customer_reviews.text: This works awesome for talking and driving instructions on Google but as far as music quality, not so great. Charging time is excellent as well. Been riding with music and directions for 4 plus hours and never a problem. Never been in rain so I can't vouch for that. Would give 5 stars of music quality had been better.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: headset review
customer_reviews.text: We just started using the headsets. We really like them so far. The vox operating system is taking some getting used to. The instructions sure could be printed out so that persons like us who only want intercom between two bikes could be easily understood. Someday I might use the blue tooth for music. Phone calls can wait. Vacations are for shut off phones. Battery life seems to be amazing and there is plenty of volume available in the speakers. Clarity is really something too. I was using a half helmet with my mic out in the wind (behind a windshield) and there was no problem.
customer_reviews.author: bowstrokes

customer_reviews.title: and its easy to talk to each other
customer_reviews.text: We use these regularly on long rides. I prefer earbuds and bought the optional earphone base, while my wife uses the speakers. it syncs well with my GPS/iPhone, and its easy to talk to each other. Battery life will go almost 24 hours straight with earbuds and mostly listening to music. And they can be charged on the fly using a USB battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! Its a whole different experience riding with them! The battery last forever, rarely have to charge them! Very easy to install! The distance with you can go before you may experience some communication issues I would say is 150 yards but that is plenty for me. If I am riding alone I Bluetooth my cellphone to it and can listen to music and if a call is coming in simply just hit the scroll button on the side to answer it! Would buy this set again!
customer_reviews.author: Alec Lucarelli

customer_reviews.title: Just Great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I rode our motorcycles to Sturgis last year and I bought these headsets just for that trip. They worked like a dream. Had one little issue at start up, but Sena customer service is great and the issue was quickly and easily resolved over the phone. They held a great charge......all day long. Clarity was wonderful. We never got out of range of each other, so I'm not sure about the effective distance. I already had an AC adapter that accepted 2 USB devices, so we could easily charge them at night.
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: life changing!
customer_reviews.text: oh wow! how could we possibly have been riding this whole time before discovering these awesome communication devices! now there's no way we would go out without them! they pair with each other and with the phones very quickly, hold the connection up to almost a mile, battery life is great and they definitely get much use in this household!.. if you do a good job installing it, you won't even know you have them - then it's a magical talking helmet! tuck in all the wires and install the headphones under the padding using the little stickers and you'll be blown away! great product - get it!
customer_reviews.author: Mana Mana

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It has excellent sound quality. The only negative is range. Pleas advise me as whether there is a way to add more range to the r/t.
customer_reviews.author: CalT52

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These work excellent riding 2-up. One earpiece had a buzz when listening to the radio. I had to return it to the mfgr at my cost and wait for a replacement. My wife likes to keep the intercom active so we can chat. Since she has an open face helmet, we don't use the voice activated feature. Unfortunately, with the intercom active, I can't listen to the radio or hear the prompts from my GPS. It would be nice to be able to rearrange the priorities of the various inputs so I could at least hear the GPS.
customer_reviews.author: R. Plant

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $300. Look Elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a motorcycle trip with my father. After twenty tries, following instructions, youtube videos, and passerby's advice, we were never able to get them to work. In short they put a big damper on the trip. Waste of $300. Now these just sit on my counter since they are scratched. Look elsewhere for a headset.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely, can't ride without it now since you can ...
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely, can't ride without it now since you can play music via bluetooth with these. The battery life is super long and the build quality is stellar. However if you own a sportsbike you can find yourself hitting the control button by accident while in riding position
customer_reviews.author: KamiAzee

customer_reviews.title: ... excited to have bluetooth in my helmet but was disappointed to find that the phone capabilities will not pair ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to have bluetooth in my helmet but was disappointed to find that the phone capabilities will not pair with my current phone - only music. And with the headset provided the sound quality is far too poor to listen to music, especially when traveling above 25 - and I have a quiet little bike! Will be returning and purchasing something different.
customer_reviews.author: Keely W

product_meta.title: Sena SMH10D-10 Motorcycle Bluetooth Headset / Intercom (Dual)
product_meta.description:
The Sena SMH10 Motorcycle Bluetooth 3.0 Headset and Intercom was designed to keep you connected to your riding companions over longer ranges for conversation and music sharing--up to 900 meters (980 yards). When paired with a Bluetooth-enabled phone, it'll also let you make hands-free calls. The SMH10 features a Helmet Clamp Kit and Boom Microphone. The Jog Dial makes for an intuitive user interface that is much easier to control while riding. The Jog Dial default is volume control, and pushing the integrated button lets you cycle through all device functions with minimal fuss, which means you'll ride safer. The SMH10 delivers crystal-clear, natural sound through the stereo Bluetooth headset that gets an automatic boost in noisy environments while Advanced Noise Control technology cuts down on background noise for both incoming and outgoing audio. The Bluetooth music playback control features play, pause, track forward and track back functions, plus each audio source has its own adjustable volume level. Integrated voice prompts (available in English, French, German, Italian and Spanish) help you quickly learn your way around the device. You'll get up to 12 hours of talk time and 10 days of stand-by time on a single charge. And even if your companions don't have Sena gear, the SMH10 uses the Universal Intercom protocol, which allows your gear to work with theirs, regardless of brand. Auxiliary audio-in connection via 0.13 inches jack.

AMAZON.COM


The SMH10D-10 is a Bluetooth v3.0 + EDR Class 1 Stereo Headset with long-range Bluetooth Intercom designed specifically for motorcycles. With the SMH10D-10, you can call hands-free on your Bluetooth mobile phone, listen to stereo music or voice instructions of GPS navigations by Bluetooth wirelessly, and have intercom conversations in full duplex with a passenger or other motorcycle riders. This package contains two full sets of SMH10 headsets and mounting accessories.

Features include Bluetooth 3.0, multi-point connection, and conferencing for up to 4 people Thanks to the latest Bluetooth v3.0 and the advanced digital processing technology, the SMH10D-10 offers the best sound quality for both incoming and outgoing sound in its class. Also, the easy-to-access and intuitive button operations make the SMH10D-10 a perfect companion for motorcycles.

BLUETOOTH V3.0 WIRELESS
SMH10D-10 can wirelessly connect to other Bluetooth devices supporting HSP/HFP (Headset Profile/Hands Free Profile) and A2DP (Advance Audio Distribution Profile). HSP/HFP is standard in all phones with Bluetooth features. Almost all Bluetooth MP3 players, smartphone, and audio dongles support A2DP to send stereo audio to Bluetooth headsets like the Sena SMH10D-10. Enjoy Bluetooth music playback control by AVRCP: play, pause, track forward and track back.

Other Bluetooth features include Multi-Pair to allow intercom functionality for 4 persons, and compatibility with select motorcycle GPS systems.

Use as an intercom, or connect to your portable devicesINDIVIDUAL ADJUSTABLE VOLUME PROFILES
You can easily decrease/increase the volume of the voice, music and intercom using Jog Dial. The SMH10D-10 can save volume levels of previously connected profiles. This means that phone volume (HSP/HFP), music volume (A2DP), and intercom volumes will be saved separately and return to its own saved volume level whenever associated profile is reconnected.

Profile volume adjustment is only affected during the use of its specific profile. However, when changing volume during standby mode, then volume change applies to all profiles. Alert tones like low battery warning and connection tones can only be adjusted in standby mode.

EASY INSTALLATION FOR MOST HELMETS
The SMH10D-10 will fit onto various types of helmets. The standard clamp, included in default packaging, will fit onto most helmets. For installations which may require extra wire length, ear buds instead of speakers, and wire microphone instead of boom microphone, Sena offers different types of clamps as an additional accessory (sold separately), to allow various installations and user preferences.

TWO-YEAR WARRANTY
The SMH10D-10 offers peace of mind in your purchase with a 2-year warranty against workmanship defects. See the warranty card in your product packaging for full details.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
The Sena SMH10D-10 Bluetooth Headset Bundle includes two full sets of the following: SMH10 speaker/microphone clamp unit, USB power and data cable, 3.5mm stereo audio jack cable, glued surface mounting adapter, microphone sponges, speaker pads, velcro pads, Allen wrench (for installation), and microphone cap, plus a manual and warranty.


TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Talk time: 12 hours
 * Standby time: 10 days
 * Working Distance (Intercom): Up to 900 meters (980 yards) in open terrain
 * Bluetooth: v3.0 + EDR
 * Audio: Built-in SBC Codec, 48kHz (DAC) sample rate
 * Battery Charging time: 2.5 hours
 * Battery Type: Lithium polymer battery
 * Headset Dimensions: 84.1 mm x 56.5 mm x 38.6 mm (3.3 in x 2.2 in x 1.5 in)
 * Headset Weight: 60 g (3.01 oz)
 * Clamp Dimensions: 223.8 mm x 85.5 mm x 30.6mm (8.8 in x 3.4 in x 1.2 in)
 * Clamp Weight: 84 g (2.96 oz)
feature_bullets: Long-range music sharing and intercom for motorcyclists--up to 900 meters (980 yards)
Bluetooth 3.0 connectivity to listen to and share music, make phone calls with speed dialing, and participate in a four-way intercom conversation
Advanced Noise Control technology cuts down on background noise for both incoming and outgoing audio
Universal Intercom protocol for cross-brand intercom compatibility
Up to 12 hours of talk time and 10 days of stand-by time on a single charge

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars909 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
